extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void sendData(java.lang.Object data)
      Deprecated. 
      Since this method is a delegate that substitutes an empty string for the tag, all objects that are sent with this method will have an identical tag. The telemetry system assumes that multiple objects sent with the same tag are just different versions of the same information, and that only the most recent version of the object is the 'correct' version. If multiple objects are sent with the same tag, only the most recently sent object will be displayed, and all others will be discarded. This makes it very impractical to send data with an empty tag, because the telemetry system will discard potentially important data.
      static void sendData(java.lang.String tag, java.lang.Object data)
      Sends given data from the robot controller to the driver station.
      static void sendMotor(Motor m)
      Sends motor data from the robot controller to the driver station.
      static void sendMotorPosition(Motor m)
      Sends motor data from the robot controller to the driver station.
      static void sendMotorPower(Motor m)
      Sends motor data from the robot controller to the driver station.
      static void sendServoPosition(Servo s)
      Sends servo data from the robot controller to the driver station.
      static void setTelemetry(com.qualcomm.robotcore.robocol.Telemetry telemetry)

    • Field Detail

      • robotTelemetry

        private static com.qualcomm.robotcore.robocol.Telemetry robotTelemetry
        The telemetry link between the robot controller and the driver station. It is used, among other things, to send debug information from the robot controller to the driver station.
        See Also:
        Telemetry

    • Constructor Detail

      • Telemetry

        private Telemetry()
        Telemetry should not be instantiable.

    • Method Detail

      • setTelemetry

        public static void setTelemetry(com.qualcomm.robotcore.robocol.Telemetry telemetry)

      • sendData

        public static void sendData(java.lang.String tag,
                            java.lang.Object data)
        Sends given data from the robot controller to the driver station. Any object can be sent, but the object's toString() method will be called and the string representation of the object is what will actually be sent. The data will be displayed in the bottom portion of the driver station's screen.
        Parameters:
        tag - a very short description of the data that is being sent. Ideally this string should be around 1-8 characters long, but an upper limit on characters is currently not known.
        data - the object to be sent.

      • sendData

        public static void sendData(java.lang.Object data)
        Deprecated. Since this method is a delegate that substitutes an empty string for the tag, all objects that are sent with this method will have an identical tag. The telemetry system assumes that multiple objects sent with the same tag are just different versions of the same information, and that only the most recent version of the object is the 'correct' version. If multiple objects are sent with the same tag, only the most recently sent object will be displayed, and all others will be discarded. This makes it very impractical to send data with an empty tag, because the telemetry system will discard potentially important data.
        Sends given data from the robot controller to the driver station. This method acts as a delegate to sendData(String, Object), but replaces the tag argument with an empty string.
        Parameters:
        data - the object to be sent.
        See Also:
        sendData(String, Object)

      • sendMotor

        public static void sendMotor(Motor m)
        Sends motor data from the robot controller to the driver station. Two entries are sent for the data, with the first being the power, and the second being the current encoder reading.

        This method works by calling sendMotorPower(Motor) followed by sendMotorPosition(Motor). Refer to the documentation for both of these methods for more information.

        Parameters:
        m - the motor to be sent.
        See Also:
        sendMotorPower(Motor), sendMotorPosition(Motor)

      • sendMotorPower

        public static void sendMotorPower(Motor m)
        Sends motor data from the robot controller to the driver station. The name of the motor is used as the tag for the data, and the power of the motor is sent as the data.
        Parameters:
        m - the motor to be sent.
        See Also:
        sendData(String, Object)

      • sendMotorPosition

        public static void sendMotorPosition(Motor m)
        Sends motor data from the robot controller to the driver station. The name of the motor is used as the tag for the data, and the reading of the encoder is sent as the data.
        Parameters:
        m - the motor to be sent.
        See Also:
        sendData(String, Object)

      • sendServoPosition

        public static void sendServoPosition(Servo s)
        Sends servo data from the robot controller to the driver station. The name of the servo is used as the tag for the data, and the position of the servo is sent as the data.
        Parameters:
        s - the servo to be sent.
        See Also:
        sendData(String, Object)
